metadata.title: CVE-2018-11712 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
WebCore/platform/network/soup/SocketStreamHandleImplSoup.cpp in the libsoup network backend of WebKit, as used in WebKitGTK+ versions 2.20.0 and 2.20.1, failed to perform TLS certificate verification for WebSocket connections.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-11712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.2-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.2-1
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.2-1').
